conversations.content: My former husband and I were lured into the Syndicate by a man known only as the Doctor. Once there, we began researching whether fusion magic could be used for legitimate and beneficial medical purposes.

Sadly, our research became the foundation upon which the Syndicate's foul experiments would be conducted. So in an attempt to atone for our sins, we conducted other work in secret—work we hoped might save victims of those experiments
So it's finally finished... This device will allow us to control the effects of wyrmbinding. But why are we building it into a sword?
You know as well as any what happens to the poor test subjects of wyrmbinding when it spins out of control.
The heat of the uncontrolled mana melts the body from the inside out. It is the most horrible sight imaginable.
There is no guarantee that this device will succeed in controlling the effects of wyrmbinding. But if it fails, we can at least grant the victim a quick and painless end.
Hence the sword. Yes, I see it now.
Perhaps I am getting ahead of myself by calling this the savior of those subjects.
And yet, I—
...The afternoon bell. Where is she?
I know, I know! I'm late.
I should not be surprised; you haven't arrived on time since we first teamed up to eliminate the Syndicate.
I won't let nothing tie me down, baby. Not even time.
So then, what did you learn from your investigation?
You were right on the money about what's causing the disappearances around here.
So it was the Syndicate...
They're using a cave on the lakeshore to the south as their base and taking all their kidnapping victims there—and I'm sure we both know what happens to 'em after that.
Human experimentation, undoubtedly. We must help these people.
Great! Then I'll bust into the base and start crackin' skulls.
You will do no such thing. That kind of unfettered bravado will accomplish nothing save getting the captives killed.
But Aldred raids bases all the time!
Yes, but this base is in a cave that could collapse in a pitched battle—especially if one uses high-powered attacks such as those from your Renegade Queen.
Yeah, I suppose you're right. Boo! So what's the plan, then?
By the looks of things, the Syndicate still hasn't caught on to the fact that I am warring against them.
The former colleague who did your hubby dirty hid that bit of information, yeah?
Yes. He said it was so I could return to the  Syndicate to be with him.
Hah, that's some self-serving ＂love＂ there...
I agree. Ironically, it now works in MY favor.
Unlike you, I've been working behind the scenes as opposed to on the front lines.
And because of that, I can easily pretend to be one of them once more.
The Lakeshore Cavern Syndicate Base
So you're the same Researcher 90 who laid the foundation for the Synthetic Shapeshifting Project, eh?
I'd heard you were an exceptionally talented mind who was permitted to go without a mask, but I never expected you to be a woman of such remarkable beauty.
Will that be a problem?
No, not at all. I was merely surprised. Now then, what brings you to this facility?
I have come to observe your experiments so I might use them to further my own research.
Your dedication to science is admirable. You'll be recruited to the upper echelons in no time with that attitude.
For my part, I'm hoping to push past the top brass and stand at the Master's right hand. And if you were to be promoted...
Naturally, I will repay you for allowing me to observe and learn from your work.
We are happy to have you for as long as you like. But if I may ask, what is that sword you carry?
I've heard tell of raids on Syndicate bases of late, so my husband gave it to me for self-defense.
Oh, I see. Of course she's married. Just my luck!
Repeat after me, you dogs! ＂For the glory of the Syndicate!＂
For the glory of the Syndicate! For the glory of the Syndicate!
This is all so wrong...
It sounds like someone needs to be reeducated. Return him to the classroom.
No! Don't take me back there again! AAAAAAAH!
I see you're brainwashing the test subjects.
We also cast a simple spell on them to enhance their physical capabilities, and train them in both the combat and espionage arts.
This base is being used to mass-produce soldiers, and any who meet our standards will be granted a Syndicate mask.
And for those who don't?
They are disposed of, which is something I would prefer to avoid. Not because I care for their lives, mind you, but because a high disposal rate impacts my bottom line.
This is why improving the success rate is one of our top priorities—and I have put our efforts into the hands of this man here, Researcher 241.
You called, Preceptor?
No... It can't be!
This is Researcher Number 241, a man of most exceptional talent.
I see you are also not required to wear a mask. Researcher 90 then, I take it?
She has come to observe our work here. Please guide her and see that she is provided with anything she needs.
It would be my honor to escort a researcher of such fabled genius!
Is something the matter? You look pale.
(He looks just like my late husband...)
This is the exercise field where we train our test subjects for combat.
(The more I look at Researcher 241, the more he resembles my husband.)
(But it can't be him. Because he's...)
Stay with me, my love! I can save you!
You of all people should know this man is beyond saving.
No... NO!
Were the escaped subjects Tf-997 and Tf-999 behind this?
We're going to investigate. Take the body to the lab. Once the autopsy is complete, return it to Researcher 90.
You're going to let her bury him, sir?
Permitting her to observe the basic rituals of death will give her the strength to carry on with her research.
(I know for a fact my husband is dead because I buried him with my own hands.)
(So this can't possibly be him.)
Is something the matter, Number 90?
No. Nothing at all.
*gasp* *wheeze* I...I can't do it... My body won't move anymore...
After all the enhancements we gave you, you can't do something this simple?
Well, sounds like this one's a dud. And you know what that means...
No! Please...
(They're going to dispose of that man. I must do something!)
(But how do I do so without revealing that I am betraying the Syndicate?)
One moment, solider. I think perhaps you're being a bit too hasty on this.
Number 241, was it? You're aware that we are supposed to dispose of subjects who fail to meet our standards, yes?
I am. However, the time required for our modifications to take effect varies from subject to subject. It's possible you are simply being impatient with this man.
I can't afford to waste space holding on  to people for who knows how long, hoping that we finally see results.
The Preceptor said we should focus on raising our success rate, did he not?
Please, give this man time. I will step up and assume all blame for asking you to stay your judgment.
Well, if you're taking the fall, then sure.
Just do your best during this training, young man. No complaints. Understood?
No! I don't understand! I don't understand ANYTHING!
You kidnapped me, experimented on me, and forced me into this insane training regimen! Why?! Why me?!
I understand how confused you must be, but you mustn't lose heart.
Every storm has an end, and every night a dawn. If you can but weather this, I know there are sunny days ahead.
This is the reference room where we store results of the procedures, records of test subjects, and the like.
Er, and I suppose that concludes the tour. Do you have any questions?
You seem to care about your test subjects. Why?
The Syndicate would likely not be too happy with me about this...
But I don't believe any life is disposable.
You are quite kind. It is one more quality you both have in common.
Sorry, who do I share that quality with?
My husband was also a researcher. Sadly, I...I lost him a short while ago.
You resemble him to a shocking degree. Your looks, your speech—even the way you move about.
He even used to say the line you just did: ＂Every storm has an end, and every night a dawn.＂
So when I look at you, I can't help but wonder if he somehow...came back to life.
...I have one more place I'd like to show you, Number 90. Come with me.
You can see the entire lake from here... It's really quite beautiful.
There's a fissure in the depths of the cavern that leads here.
Sometimes when I'm stuck on something in my research, I'll come here to get a breath of fresh air. I suppose it's my own secret hideaway, in a sense.
And why did you bring me here?
Because I brought up some hard memories for you—about your husband, I mean.
Is this supposed to cheer me?
A sad attempt, I know, but I fear research is the only thing I have any real talent for.
You're even as awkward as he was...
So, um...my name is Barth.
I know your husband and I were both researchers for the Syndicate, but... I'm not him. I'm sorry.
Still, it's clear that your husband lives on in your heart.
So please let go of that pain if you can. I'm sure your husband would not have wanted that for you, after all.
...You're right. You're absolutely right.
I live on, carrying the burden of his hopes.
Thank you, Barth. Oh, and I am Grace.
That's a lovely name.
(Barth is right. Even though they share so many qualities, he is not my husband.)
(But then why does my heart beat so fast when I am around him...?)
May I see you for a moment, Grace?
You had best be careful using my true name in front of Syndicate soldiers. You know it is against policy.
Right! I'm so sorry, Number 90.
Now, what was it that you needed, Number 241?
I wanted to ask your opinion on the numbers we received from this physical- enhancement experiment.
...Ah, so THAT'S where it went wrong! You really are an incredible researcher. It's like you know everything!
And I am rather impressed by your own creativity. I think I could learn a great deal from picking your brain.
Then why don't we get together for a meeting of the minds tomorrow? Er...perhaps go out for a meal?
Outside the facility?
I received permission from the Preceptor for both of us to leave the base.
So I was thinking maybe we could... get something to eat at the nearby town? But only if you want, of course!
I'm sorry, Barth, but I fear I've nothing to wear for such an occasion save this outfit and a mourning gown.
Oh, then you can wear the gown! I don't mind. Really.
Yes, but I would feel rather awkward dining out in public in my widow's weeds.
Oh, of course! I'm so sorry—this was all just completely out of line. I'll go now.
Wait!
Now that I think about it, it's possible there wouldn't be as many people about if we went for a late dinner.
That was absolutely delectable.
It certainly was—though I think I enjoyed our conversation as much as the meal.
(I know I shouldn't keep comparing Barth to my husband...)
(But my heart swells when I am with him. It is as if I have gone back in time.)
Er, Grace? I know we've only just met, but...I find myself quite charmed by you.
Both as a fellow researcher and... and as a man.
Oh, Barth...
I know I can never replace your husband. But I believe I can make you happy in the same way he did.
So if you will have me—
Comin' through, loser!
Psst! I'll be waiting in that alley!
Heavens! What a rude woman!
Er, I just remembered that I have a place I need to be. I'll meet you back at the base.
Oh, um...all right?
You could stand to learn a bit of subtlety, Bellina. Not every problem needs to be attacked straight on like a raging bull.
Okay, back off, toots! I'm just here to make sure you ain't forgot the reason you went into that base in the first place.
Of course not. In fact, I have figured out a plan for our rescue operation. Listen...
...Gotcha. In that case, I'll get back to the Halidom and recruit some extra hands.
Everyone is counting on you.
Preparations will probably take a week, so I suggest having all your personal biz wrapped up by them.
I'm sorry? My...biz?
Yeah, with the sad sack who's trying to put the moves on you! He's your enemy, remember?
Barth is not like other people in the Syndicate. I believe we might be able to bring him to our side.
Well, you've got a week to find out. But if lover boy over there won't switch  sides, you know what you have to do.
Gra...I mean, Number 90, you have been granted permission to access the Rank 4 documents you requested. Here is the key to the storage shelf.
Oh, but I am jealous! I've requested access to these documents dozens of times for my work and have been turned away at every opportunity.
That is a shame.
Oh, and...about last night. Please forget what I said.
I'll tell you what I wanted to say at another time—and in a place where we can be assured of privacy.
All right.
Um...Researcher 241? What do you think about the Syndicate?
I think it should reconsider how lightly it treats the lives of test subjects.
The Syndicate is trying to right a world filled with wrongs, but we can't make that happen if we don't use the supplies we have to their fullest extent.
I'm sorry. Did you just refer to the test subjects as SUPPLIES?
Life is not something to be cast aside at a whim! Every life, no matter how meager, can be of use to the Syndicate.
And that's how you really feel?
Of course! Those are the ideals of the Syndicate, and I joined because I agreed with them. Was it not the same for you?
Y-yes, of course. Well, I must be going.
(I did not realize how fully immersed Barth is in the Syndicate's way of thinking.)
(So long as this is the case, he can never be an ally to our cause.)
Well, you've got a week to find out. But if lover boy over there won't switch sides, you know what you have to do.
(I know she's right, and yet...)
Pump those little legs, you maggot! I want you at the training grounds NOW!
*whimper*
Enough. I cannot spent the rest of my time here fretting about such things.
(Our plan does not end when we help these captives escape—we must also aid them in returning to their normal lives after the pain they have suffered.)
(And we cannot do that if we don't learn everything there is to know about the Syndicate's research.)
This must be where they keep the Rank 4 research papers. Let's see what we have here...
＂Observational Recordings of Human-Weapon Hybrids...＂ ＂Field Notes on Reconstructive Entomological Surgeries...＂
Wait, hold on. ...What in the world? ＂Magical Fusion Duplication＂?
But this experiment was performed by...!
One week later...
I'm here, Grace. Now will you please tell me why you wanted to meet with me in the dead of night?
I need to speak with you about the ideals held by my former husband and myself.
Your...ideals?
My husband and I were researching ways fusion magic could be used for medicinal purposes. We hoped it might help those who had lost limbs due to war or illness.
And we turned a blind eye to the inhumane actions of the Syndicate, believing that the lives saved through our research would make up for any evil otherwise committed.
But we were wrong. A life lost can never be regained, and the tragedies brought about by our research cannot be undone.
What are you trying to say?
You said you were here because you agreed with the ideals of the Syndicate.
But I don't—not after what my husband and I did to those people. We stole them from their homes, placed them in chains... We took EVERYTHING from them.
My only purpose in life now is to atone for the sins of my past.
Look, if this is your roundabout way of rejecting me, that's fine.
But you make it sound like you want to betray the Syndicate itself!
So you still don't remember.
Remember what?
There was one other reason why I called you out here, Barth. I need to—
Enemy incoming! Enemy incoming! All soldiers, prepare to intercept!
Get ready, chumps, because the Renegade Queen is here to WRECK YOU! WOOOOOO!
That is the subject Bauer permitted to escape! If we capture her, he will finally be put in his place!
Gather everyone able to bear arms and converge on her! I will not permit that woman to slip our net a second time!
The raiders out there are apparently former Syndicate test subjects, which means they're a tough lot for sure.
Eh, we're just guarding the test subjects, so it's not like it makes any—URK!
That's the last of them.
I'm gonna open your cell now, 'kay?
Are you here to save us?
Yes indeed! Now retreat with us back to the Halidom! RETREEEEEAT!
What are you doing, Grace?! You can't free these subjects!
Besides, even if you do, the soldiers posted outside the base are sure to notice a group of this size!
Not if there's an escape route they don't know about.
...! The fissure in the cavern!
Our decoy will draw the attention of the soldiers outside while our friends slip in and seize control of the base.
From there, they'll free the captives and lead them to the escape route.
And you brought me here to silence me. Is that it?
It must be. After all, I'm the only other person who knows about that path.
It's true that I could buy us a tremendous amount of time by silencing you...
But I know the real you understands this: No matter what ideals the Syndicate may espouse, their methods are unacceptable.
So come with me. Let's escape together.
There's only one me. The one you see right before you.
And thus I would instead ask of you, will you not reconsider your path?
It seems we're at an impasse. And there's no time... I'm sorry, Barth.
Hrk?!
They're supposed to be right around... Ah, there you are!
You're late, Bellina!
What can I say? Got carried away kicking some Syndicate butt. How's everyone else?
Alain is guiding the people we saved back to the Halidom, and Grace...
Want me to set him down here?
Please. When that's done, can you help Vida escort the captives out?
Of course.
Grace? Please tell me you didn't knock lover boy out and drag him along with us.
You said you'd persuade him, not clock him on the head until little birdies flew out of it going cheep cheep cheep!
He was not prepared to leave the Syndicate, so force was my only option.
Then that means he's a THREAT, Grace. So again, why the hell is he here?
Because it was the right thing to do. This man was subjected to experiments just as you were.
Wait. He was what?
I found documents describing the experiments performed by the Doctor while he was still alive.
One was called ＂Magical Fusion Duplication,＂ the goal of which was to create copies of key Syndicate leadership in the event of their deaths.
The Doctor would take a piece of the dead and combine it with a portion of a fiend possessing regenerative properties.
The subject born from that experiment— re-241—had the same appearance and intellect as the deceased man they used to create him.
Once the process was complete, the Syndicate made him a researcher in order to learn if the man's mind was as good of a match as the body.
Okay, hang on. So you mean...
That man became Researcher 241, the person who now lies before you.
And the body used to create him... was my husband.
As Grace grew close to a Syndicate researcher named Barth, she eventually learned he was created from the body of her former husband.
Okay, so lover boy over there is actually your reincarnated husband?
Not exactly. Though he looks identical, he did not receive any of my husband's memories.
He's lived his entire life based on false pretenses given to him by the Syndicate.
So he has no idea he actually sprang out of a tank of goo or whatever?
No, they hid that—likely to prevent him from suffering a mental breakdown. It seems the only person who knew the entire truth was the Preceptor.
Okay, so he's another experiment. But there's something that doesn't sit right with me...
Unlike all the other experiments, he didn't have his freedom taken away.
And it also sounds like he had no intention of leaving the Syndicate. So what was the point in saving him?
He deserves to know his origins—and once he does, I am positive he will come to understand our position.
You said they used parts of a fiend to make him, right?
So how can you guarantee he won't be a danger—and why are you so damn sure he'll want to join up with us?
I suppose I'm not certain on either count.
Tell me it isn't true.
Barth! You're awake!
I've actually been awake for a while now. Tell me it isn't true, Grace. Tell me I'm not made from fiend parts even though... even though it all makes so much sense.
My past has never felt like my own. Never. It's more like a series of images that I've never been able to connect with.
My voice? My appearance? It's not me! It all belongs to your husband!
I am so sorry, Barth.
So is that who I am?! Did I even choose to fall in love with you, or was that all just some predetermined outcome?!
I don't know... I don't know! I don't know I don't know Idon'tknowIdon'tknowIdon't AAAAAAAAAAAAAH!
What's happening to him?!
He's having a mental breakdown which is causing the fiend inside him to react!
GRAAAAAAAGH!
Stop this, Barth! You must remain calm!
I'm sorry, Grace, but he's too far gone. Renegade Queen!
Gyaaaaah!
BELLINA!
GRAAAAARGH!
This is terrible! We have to find a way to stop him before he kills us all!
GRAAAAAAAGH!
Stop, my love!
GRAAAAA... Rrrrrrrgh?
What's happening?! Is he hurt?!
Nnngh... ROOOOAAAAGGHHH!
No! There's a cliff over there!
GRAAAAAAAAAAH!
...I found him, Grace.
I assume his condition is grave?
You saw how huge of a drop that was. Fiend or not, there was no way he was gonna be okay.
He'll probably die if we leave him here, but...what do you want to do?
Rr...rrrrggggh... Ggg...raaaa...ce...
Atone...ment...
Perhaps I am getting ahead of myself by calling this the savior of those subjects.
But I will wield this sword if it is the only hope they have left.
Perhaps it's not the right way to save them, but I won't use that excuse to simply stand by and do nothing.
Though I am plagued with regrets and doubt, I will still do what is right.
That is the only way I can atone.
My death was the only thing I could think about after I lost the man I loved.
But that changed after I met Aldred. I decided to live again so I might walk the path of atonement once more.
And now you've allowed me to question that anew.
To reaffirm I have the strength to atone, no matter how painful it might be.
I'm sorry. And...thank you.
I really thought this might work, Bellina. I yearned for it with all that I am.
I kept hoping that my husband's memories were lying dormant inside Barth and that we could somehow bring them back.
You can't bring back the dead. That's why we make the most of the life we have— and why you're atoning.
You're right.
But right at the end there, that fiend could have been acting on your husband's wishes.
...I think it's all right for you to imagine that much.
Thank you, Bellina.
I never thought the day would come where you would be comforting me.
What, you think I can't comfort people?!
Let us make our way to the Halidom. We need to take care of those people we freed from the Syndicate.
(I may waver or be overcome with despair in the future, but I will not falter.)
(I will embrace all of those feelings and continue moving forward.)
(Because that is how we atone, my love.)
